page.title: 12Linton and Cornwallis School
page.content:
{Cornwallis School}was opened in Sept. l958 and is named after Lord Cornwallis who lived in Linton Manor at the time. It is a co-educational secondary school. Children from the feeder Primary schools either remain at the school until the end of their fifth year or they transfer to grammar schools.
No bigger than a hamlet,{Linton}lies on the main road between Maidstone and Staplehurst. On the hill is the Bull Inn. Its front is ochre-tinted and is dated l674. The church is located on the edge of the Linton Park grounds. The mansion now known as Linton Park was built around 1750 and after the Cornwallis family left it became, briefly, a school, then offices and is presently vacant pending its sale.
